titleStmt.title: The phœnix of these late times: or the life of Mr. Henry Welby, Esq . who lived at his house in Grub-street forty foure yeares, and in that space, was never seene by any, aged 84. Shewing the first occasion, and the reasons thereof. Whose portracture, you may behold, as it was taken at his death. With epitaphs and elegies of the late deceased gentleman, who lyeth buried in S. Giles Church neere Criple gate, London.
titleStmt.author: Heywood, Thomas, d. 1641.

titleStmt.title: The phœnix of these late times: or the life of Mr. Henry Welby, Esq . who lived at his house in Grub-street forty foure yeares, and in that space, was never seene by any, aged 84. Shewing the first occasion, and the reasons thereof. Whose portracture, you may behold, as it was taken at his death. With epitaphs and elegies of the late deceased gentleman, who lyeth buried in S. Giles Church neere Criple gate, London.
titleStmt.author: Heywood, Thomas, d. 1641.
Marshall, William, fl. 1617-1650, engraver.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by N. Okes, and are to be sold by Richard Clotterbuck at his shop in little Brittaine, at the signe of the golden ball,

notesStmt.note: The portrait is signed: WM sculpt:, i.e. William Marshall.
This edition ends on F3; the last leaf is blank.
Variant: title has ".. by any. Aged 84.".
Identified as STC 25227 on UMI microfilm reel 1261, and as STC 25228 on reel 1562.
Reproductions of the originals in the British Library and the Bodleian Library.
Appears at reel 1261 (British Library copy) and at reel 1562 (Bodleian Library copy).
